results.content: Really enjoyed the course and notes. I found the projects very useful. The only issue I had was with the natural language processing network, I was unable to follow along as the Twitter developer codes seem to have changed. Perhaps that lecture needs to be updated.
results.content_html: Really enjoyed the course and notes. I found the projects very useful. The only issue I had was with the natural language processing network, I was unable to follow along as the Twitter developer codes seem to have changed. Perhaps that lecture needs to be updated.

results.content: This Course is wonderful. I just finished it and can say without a shadow of a doubt that it was worth every second of the 17 hours. For anyone interested in data analysis this course will provide a solid, stable basis on top of which the applied aspect of analysis will stand. Anyone who takes this course will have a huge advantage in the work force compared to their peers who have not undergone such training. Just WONDERFUL!

results.content: Great Teaching. Great course if you are a beginner to R. Material for further learning also mentioned in the course
results.content_html: Great Teaching. Great course if you are a beginner to R. Material for further learning also mentioned in the course

results.content:
This course gave me a very good overview of data science and machine learning concepts! The instructor also breaks down difficult topics in a more digestible way and even redirects us to a few very useful resource materials.
There are a series of projects in this course, which allow us to learn and get used to things way faster.

results.content:
Best classes for reviewing how to use R for data analysis.
I totally recommend this class for someone who wants to learn R.

results.content: As I was only in touch with the theory on all the different ML-Algorithms, this course was a brilliant way to learn by doing, how I can actually use all these techniques. Thanks so much!

results.content: Yes. The lectures all build upon each other leading. There is a nice sequential order that makes sense and everything is clearly explained in simple examples. Perfect for any STEM student.
